lines.text: Do you hate Rocky?
No, I don't hate Balboa. I pity the fool, and I will destroy any man who tries to take what I got!
[During Rocky's training with Apollo, he's in an another world, haunted by the first Balboa-Lang fight; Apollo lands some practice hooks]
He's hooking. He's hooking. He's hooking! Damn, Rock, Come on! What's the matter with you?
Tomorrow. Let's do it tomorrow.

[Screaming]
There is no tomorrow! THERE IS NO TOMORROW! THERE IS NO TOMORROW!
What are you doing? I wanna fight this guy.
Well, you got him. But you'll fight him without me.
What are you saying?
It's finished. Yes, I'm finished. I don't want no more of this. I don't want no more of it! You understand? None of it! It's over with!
[Mickey walks away from the crowd in frustration]

[Calling to Adrian; Smooth talks]
Hey, Woman. Hey, Woman! Listen here. Since your old man ain't got no heart, maybe you like to see a real man. I bet you stay up late every night dreamin' you had a real man, don't ya? I'll tell you what. Bring your pretty little self over to my apartment tonight, and I'll show you a real man.

[loses his temper completely; Screaming]
You want it, you got it! YOU GOT IT!
[Both Rocky and Clubber taunt and yells; crowd clamors]

[Screaming continues]
I'll see you in the ring! You got it!
You know, Stallion? It's too bad we gotta get old, huh?
Ah, just keep punchin', Apollo... you want to ring the bell?
Alright... Ding Ding.
What's your prediction for the fight?
My prediction?
Yes, your prediction.
[Clubber looks into camera]
Pain!
[Adrian, deeply concerned, walks towards Rocky on the beach]
Can I talk to you? I wanna ask you something important, and I want you to tell me the truth.
What?
Why'd you come here?
I just don't want it no more.
If it's over because you want it to be over, I'm glad.
I do.
It's just... you never quit anything since I known you.
I don't know what you want me to say. I mean, what happened? How did everything that was so good get so bad?
What's so bad? Tell me, what?

I wrecked everything by not thinking for myself. I mean, why couldn't Mickey tell me where I really at right from the start? He didn't have to carry me and lie to me and make me think I was better than I really was when I wasn't.
Now, when we fought, you had that eye of the tiger, man; the edge! And now you gotta get it back, and the way to get it back is to go back to the beginning. You know what I mean?
[Rocky and Thunderlips have completed their exhibition match, which has been more violent than Rocky expected]
Good match.
Hey why'd you get so crazy on me out there?
That's the name of the game.
[Crowd yelling/disapproves Rocky's choice to retire; Clubber appears in the crowd]
Getting out while you can? Don't give this sucker no statue. Give him guts! I told you I wasn't going away. You got your shot, now give me mine.

[Telling Clubber to go away]
Why don't you get the hell out of there?

Shut up, Old Man! I ain't goin' nowhere. Why don't you all these nice folks why you been duckin' me? Politics, man. This country want to keep me down. Keep everybody weak. They don't want me to have the title because I'm not a puppet like that fool up there.
You know, you got a big mouth, you know?
Well, why don't you come down here and close it, Balboa? Come on. Come on.

[turning cross]
Anytime.
This guy's crazy. Don't listen to him.

The little man don't wanna come to me. Then I'll come to you people to lay out the truth. I am ranked Number One. ONE! That means I'm the best! But this bum been taking the easy matches, fighting other bums. I'm telling you and everybody here, I'm fight him anywhere, anytime, for nothing.
[crowd shouting]
But you people ain't never gonna see that happen because he's gonna retire. You see, he don't fight no real man. He fights those setups.
What?

[yells]
You're a disgrace to this sport!

[Screams]
Shut up, Old Man! You don't know what I had to come from! Balboa, your family doin' real nice, ain't it, and you call yourself a fighter? Prove it now. Give me that same chance. The way you been duckin' is a disgrace. If he ain't no coward, why don't he fight me then?
I can't listen to any more of this. Anytime you want...

[extremely angry; Screams]
I don't care what you're ranked! You don't get no shot AND I MEAN THAT!
I said why you doin' this?
Because you can't win, Rock! This guy will kill you to death inside of three rounds!
You're crazy.
What else is new?
He's just another fighter.
No, he ain't just another fighter! This guy is a wrecking machine! And he's hungry! Hell, you ain't been hungry since you won that belt.
What are you talkin' about? I had ten title defenses.
That was easy.
What you mean, "easy"?
They was hand-picked!
Setups?
Nah, they wasn't setups. They was good fighters, but they wasn't killers like this guy. He'll knock you to tomorrow, Rock!

[before the rematch with Rocky]
Hey, boy. Hey, boy. After I crucify him, you next.
Just stay outta my face, chump.
[turns his back on Clubber]
Don't turn your back on me, sucka!
[he shoves Apollo and a melee breaks out]

[after the scuffle is broken up]
I thought you said be cool!
That *was* cool!
Why'd you leave? Why'd you walk away like that?
Life's too short, kid.
Where you goin?
I'm goin on a permanent vacation.
What are you talkin about? We got one more fight.
No, no, not me, you.
Why you doin this?
[Mickey doesn't answer]
I said why you doin this?
Because you can't win, Rock! This guy'll kill you to death inside of three rounds!
You're crazy!
What else is new?
He's just another fighter!
No he ain't just another fighter. This guy is a wrecking machine and he's hungry! Hell, you ain't been hungry since you won that belt!
Aw, what are you talking about I've had 10 title defenses?
That was easy!
What do you mean easy?
They was hand picked!
Set ups?
Nah they wasn't set ups! They was good fighters but they wasn't killers like this guy. He'll knock you to tomorrow, Rock!
Jeez, Mick. Why'd you do it?
Because the beating that you got from Apollo should've killed you, kid. It didn't. It was my job to keep you winning and to keep you healthy.
You really don't think I got nothing left do you?

Well, Rock, let's put it this way. Now, three years ago you was supernatural. You was hard and you was nasty and you had this cast-iron jaw but then the worst thing happened to you, that could happen to any fighter. You got civilized. But don't worry kid. You know, presidents retire, horses retire, Man-o-war retired. They put him out to stud. That's what you should've done, retired.
I can't retire knowing all this, Mick.
...you gotta want to do it for the right reasons. Not for the guilt over Mickey, not for the people, not for the title, not for money or me, but for you. Just you. Just you alone.
And if I lose?
Then you lose. But at least you lose with no excuses, no fear. And I know you can live with that.
I'm the baddest man in the world.
You don't look so bad to me.
What did you say, Paper Champion? I'll beat you like a dog, a dog, you fool!
Thunderlips is here. In the flesh, baby. The ultimate male versus... the ultimate meatball. Ha, ha, ha.
[Opening scenes; Clubber Lang beats a fighter, making him the #1 contender; threatens and taunts Mickey in the audience]

[Screaming]
I want Balboa! I want Balboa! You hear that, Old Man? You tell Balboa to come here! Nobody can beat me! You tell him what I said! And he's NEXT! I'm gonna kill him! Nobody can stop me! You tell Balboa that! I'M COMING AFTER HIM! YOU TELL HIM!

[gets his picture taken with Thunderlips]
Y'know, sometimes charity really hurts.
Nothing is real if you don't believe in who you are!

[during the rematch with Lang]
He's gettin' killed out there!
No, no, no! He ain't gettin' killed; he's gettin' mad!
[Thunderlips makes his entrance into the arena]
Let's get out of here.
Aw, c'mon Mick, it's for charity.
You're wearing your anatomy out for charity. Nobody else does this much for charity.
Bob Hope would.

[pause, nods]
That's true.

[referring to African-Americans ]
I don't like these people.
You don't like em'? Well maybe they don't like you either Paulie.

[in awe]
What'd I ever do to them?

[looks at Adrian]
And they call ME "Punchy".
See that look in their eyes, Rock? You gotta get that look back, Rock. Eye of the tiger, man.
You ain't so bad, you ain't so bad, you ain't nothin'. C'mon, champ, hit me in the face! My mom hits harder than you!
You thought I was tough? This chump will kill you!
I'm going to bust you up.
Go for it.
Dead meat!
Now, when you beat me, you beat me by one... ONE... second. Now do you know what something like that does to a man of my intelligence?
I thought you said you got over it.
I lied.
Can he swim?
With a name like "Rock"!

[leaving the police station]
You wann hear I owe ya? You I owe nothin'!
No you don't owe me nothin'.
So, what do you want I should do? My sister ain't here?
She's home.
You know, me and her used to be tight before you come in. I raise her she don't come down.
She don't know about this.
You can just up and go to hell, you know that?
Hey, watch your mouth, Paulie.
What? You gonna whack me? I don't sweat you. I don't sweat you!
Come on, Paulie, why don't you screw your head on right.
My head? You're freakin' head's the one's on wrong.
Me? What'd I do?
You? Nothin'! You get your face all fixed up. Handsome. Nice clothes. What'd you do for Paulie, anything? This! You give me a lousy, stinkin' ex-lax watch. There!
[throws his watch on the ground]

[going to pick up watch]
Hey, Paulie, come on.

[kicks watch away]
No, no, no leave it down there! It never kept good time anyway. You know, you forget when you were a punk and those guys used to laugh at you because you were so jive? Who used to whack them bums out, huh?
They laughed at both of us.
Nobody laughed at me. Who was it got you your first woman, huh? Me! Paulie! I was responsible!
She was pregnant.

So what, you wasn't no prize either. You know I give you, I give you. You buy a new house, right? You move Mick in with you, right? Did you ask me? Is there somethin' the matter with me? I got feelings you, know.
[points to his heart]
This ain't cardboard.
Hey, everybody's got 'em, Paulie.
To hell with everybody.
No, maybe it's to hell with you.
I don't think I want to listen to this crap.
Come on, you act like everybody owes you a livin'.
Shut your mouth.
Nobody owes nobody nothin'. You owe yourself.
You're wrong! Friends owe!
Friends don't owe! They do because the wanna do.
Shut your freakin' mouth. You been keepin' me down!

Down? You know, you're like a crazy brother to me, Paulie, you really are. So I'm gonna tell ya something and I want you to listen because I really mean this. You ain't down. And you ain't even a loser. You're just a jealous, lazy bum.
Alright, I'm gonna break your freakin' mouth up! I'm gonna break your freakin' mouth up!
[Paulie throws punches at Rocky and Rocky blocks them]

[exhausted]
Can I have a job?
All you had to do was ask.
[starts walking toward Rocky's car]
Hey, you know, you punch pretty good.
Really?
Absolutely.

[looking at Rocky's car]
This new?
Yeah.
Cost a lot?
Yeah, a few bucks.
Got an extra one?

[Mickey is not pleased with Rocky's exhibition match with Thunderlips]
What's the matter with you? Why do you wanna fight this guy? Does anything normal go through your head?
Nothing that I remember.
I seen wrestlers as big as dinosaurs. You ever fought a dinosaur, kid?
Not lately.
They can inflict a variety of damage!

If you stand toe-to-toe with this bum, he'll kill you. It doesn't take a man to stand there and get your head beat off...! He's just a man, Rock, so be MORE man than him! Go get him; Eye Of the Tiger!
We'd like to announce the presence at ringside of a true champion; the Master of Disaster, the Count of Monte Fisto, the one, the only Apollo Creed!
[Creed enters the ring and walks over to Lang]

[slaps Creed's hand away]
Get out of my face! I don't need no has-beens in my corner. And you better wipe that look off your face before I knock it off. You wanna jump, JUMP! Come on! Come on, Creed! Come on!

[Creed walks away to speak to Rocky]
Do everybody a favor and knock this chump out.
Do you have any predictions on this fight? How do you see this fight going?
Well, I feel that strength would have to go to the challenger, while experience and the WORLD'S HARDEST HEAD would HAVE to go to Rocky Balboa, and you know I know about that!
Excuse me. Could I get a kiss?
Yeah, sure.
[the fan kisses him, but Mickey pushes her back]
Get outta here! Will ya? This is like fighting in a zoo. This is a zoo, you know? Is that the way you train for Clubber? He ain't gonna kiss ya! He gonna kill ya! Ya know that?
How did you get so tough?
I live with a fighter.
[a special, surprise gathering is being held at the Philadelphia Museum of Art; A high school band finished playing "Gonna Fly Now"; citizens applauses]

Thank you. Thank you, One and all. Every once in a while a person comes along who defies the odds, who defies logic, and fulfills an incredible dream. On behalf of all the citizens of Philadelphia, and the many who have been touched by your accomplishments and your untiring participation in this city's many charity functions, it is with tremendous honor that we present this memorial which will stand always as a celebration to the indomitable spirit of Man. Philadelphia salutes its favorite son, Rocky Balboa!
[Fans cheer and applause; unveils the bronze statue of The Italian Stallion, Rocky Balboa; cheering grows louder]
It's beautiful.
Definitely a thing of beauty.
[Fans cheering "Rocky"]
Thank you.
[clear throat]

Thank you very much. I don't know. Wh-What do ya say to something like this? About three years ago... this city... really took me inside, you know? And I want to thank you very much for that. I really do. And I've been thinking that, uh, I wasn't gonna bring this up, but I might as well now. I would never do anything to hurt this sport that has been so really good to me. And I've been talking it over with my wife... and my manager... We think that...
[Confused]
It's really hard to say this. I feel like, well... I thinking maybe it's time that I should, uh, step down maybe and... retire.
I'm gonna torture him. I'm gonna crucify him. Real bad.
Don't listen to it, Rocky.
No, do listen to it Rock. Because when it's over, everybody's gonna owe you an engraved apology. And you're gonna owe me a favor.
What favor?
When it's over Rock.
No one can believe the superhuman strength of Thunderlips!
So I predict that the champ's gonna take this one.
Now wait a minute! Do you really think the champ can hit that hard?
Why do you think I'm sitting out here with you?
Two...
No, No, not yet. Not for the meatball. I'm not done with him yet, boy. If I can't break your spirit, I sure enough can break your back!
[Thunderlips cracks Rocky's vertebrae]

[to Rocky Right Before The Final Fight]
Hey fool! You ready for another beating? You shoulda never came back!
Why are you doing this?
Because you can't win Rock. This guy will kill you to death in three rounds.
Hey Mick what do you think this guy eats?
About 202 pounds

[Thunderlips is walking to the ring]
Why are they carrying him?
He's walking.

[to orchestra playing the "Rocky" theme]
Shut up back there, can't you? Change your tune.
you got civilized.
[a special, surprise gathering is being held at the Philadelphia Museum of Art; A high school band finished playing "Gonna Fly Now"; citizens applauses]

Thank you. Thank you, One and all. Every once in a while a person comes along who defies the odds, who defies logic, and fulfills an incredible dream. On behalf of all the citizens of Philadelphia, and the many who have been touched by your accomplishments and your untiring participation in this city's many charity functions, it is with tremendous honor that we present this memorial which will stand always as a celebration to the indomitable spirit of Man. Philadelphia salutes its favorite son, Rocky Balboa!
[Fans cheer and applause; unveils the bronze statue of The Italian Stallion, Rocky Balboa; cheering grows louder]
It's beautiful.
Definitely a thing of beauty.
[Fans cheering "Rocky"]
Thank you.
[clear throat]

Thank you very much. I don't know. Wh-What do ya say to something like this? About three years ago... this city... really took me inside, you know? And I want to thank you very much for that. I really do. And I've been thinking that, uh, I wasn't gonna bring this up, but I might as well now. I would never do anything to hurt this sport that has been so really good to me. And I've been talking it over with my wife... and my manager... We think that...
[Confused]
It's really hard to say this. I feel like, well... I thinking maybe it's time that I should, uh, step down maybe and... retire.
You know Stallion?
What?
It's too bad we've got to get old.
[Thunderlips is holding Rocky in the air; calls to the audience]

[yells]
No one can believe the superhuman strength of Thunderlips! I am the Man!
Stop him, will -
[a heart attack occurs]
You want this punching bag?
Adrian!
Rocky!
THEN YOU GOT HIM!

[Screaming]
CATCH ME!
[Tunderlips tosses Rocky out of the ring into the audience]

[to Clubber]
Don't go wasting your punches! He's gotta come to you; you're the Champ! Don't try to take him out with one punch! Use your head; wear him down!

[announcing the wrestling match]
Now entering the ring, a man who calls himself the ultimate male, World Wrestling Champion, Thunderlips!

[looking at Thunderlips]
Wow, he's awful big. Hey, Mick, how much do you think he eats?
About 202 pounds.
Weighing in at 202 pounds...
[Mickey smiles and looks at Rocky]
Hey, Rock; you better call Bob Hope.

[after Thunderlips slams Rocky to the canvas]
Rocko, remember the neighborhood!

[Mickey has revealed to Rocky the truth about his title defenses]
Geez, Mick, why'd you do it?
Because the beating ya got from Apollo shoulda killed ya, kid. It didn't. It was my job ta keep ya winnin', and ta keep ya healthy.

[as Rocky prepares to fight Thunderlips]
Stay away! Make faces! Move around the ring! You got him, kid!
He IS the ring!

[as Rocky makes the sign of the cross in his corner]
I get nervous EVERY TIME he does that!

[to Rocky after watching all the pageantry at the gym]
This is a house of ill repute!

[Rocky as he reads the story about Goldilocks to his son]
Then what happened to Goldilocks?
Happened to her? I'm not exactly sure.
Busted for trespassing and got 30 days in the cooler.
Oh, that's real nice, Paulie.
